subject: Real Estate
title: Housing Supply Lag
description: A quick, practical guide to Housing Supply Lag.

hook.text: When demand for housing surges, it takes 2â€“5 years for builders to deliver new supply.

buildup.text: Permits, zoning, construction, and inspections create a pipeline that can't be rushed easily.

discovery.text: This lag means prices overshoot during booms because supply can't keep up in time.

twist.text: By the time new homes are ready, demand may have already cooled â€” creating a glut instead.

climax.text: The supply lag is why housing markets are inherently cyclical. Timing never matches perfectly.

punchline.text: By the time you build it, the market may not come.

quiz.question: Why do housing prices overshoot during booms?
options: Supply can't keep up with rapid demand
